meanings.definition: A person who supports or agrees with a motion or proposal made by another.
meanings.sent1: The seconders in the meeting all raised their hands in agreement.
meanings.sent2: The seconders signed the petition to show their support for the cause.
meanings.sent3: The seconders at the party all cheered loudly for the winning team.
meanings.sent4: She was like a seconder in the play, always ready to step in and support the lead actor.
meanings.sent5: The seconders were like a strong foundation, holding up the idea with their unanimous agreement.

meanings.definition: The act of officially supporting or endorsing a motion or proposal made by another.
meanings.sent1: The seconder of the motion stood up to express their support.
meanings.sent2: The seconders of the proposal all signed the document to make it official.
meanings.sent3: The seconder of the idea brought balloons to celebrate its endorsement.
meanings.sent4: The seconders were like the pillars of the building, ensuring the motion stood strong.
meanings.sent5: Their seconder was like a stamp of approval, making the proposal official and recognized.
